about_the_game:
D.A.M. Champion is a dark comedy monster tamer game inspired by video games and TV shows during the age of GBA and GBA SP handheld gaming. The story of D.A.M. Champion is set in a dystopian world where most of the world’s economy is connected to technology that involves creating and managing artificial copies of the wild monsters in their world. Humans have been learning more about the monsters in the world through the use of this technology.

Explore multiple regions and ecosystems in the world of D.A.M. Champion. Become a stronger and more skilled tamer through your experiences as you travel. Decide what type of Champion you would want to be and what values that you hold to be important. Through your journey you will meet different types of people, some may be kind and others may reveal some of the most unsettling dispositions in the region.

- 14 Monster Types

- 120 Monsters

- 31 Abilities

- Over 170 Attack Skills

- Customizable Monster Stats

- (3 vs 3) and (3 vs 3+) combat

- Original Music Tracks by Plastov

- Official Monster Artwork by Hikoku

- Turn-Based Combat

- 3 Difficulty Settings That Affect Main Boss Battles

- Multiple Save Slots

- Designed by a single game developer

  • OS *: Microsoft® Windows® XP / Vista / 7 (32-bit/64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel® Pentium® 4 2.0 GHz equivalent or faster processor
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Graphics: 1024 x 768 pixels or higher desktop resolution

Recommended:

short_description: Assemble a team of monsters for turn-based battles in this dark comedy Non-Linear RPG. The world of D.A.M. Champion takes an original approach to the concept of being a protagonist in a monster-taming game. This is not a game for small kids.
